question_text: A 50-year-old woman is evaluated for an asymptomatic, soft growth on the back of the neck, as shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: Acrochordons (skin tags) (Option A) are soft, pedunculated, fleshy, benign papules that occur on the sides and back of the neck, axillae, inframammary region, groin, and buttocks. They may be caused by friction or increased levels of insulin or insulin-like growth factors; acrochordons are often seen in patients with diabetes mellitus or obesity. A familial predisposition may also be associated with these lesions.
